On the anniversary of 9/11, let us remember all the brave individuals who went into danger to save their fellow Americans, and grieve with those who lost family, friends, and colleagues in the attacks and their aftermath. 
#NeverForget
Today I remember and honor my cousin John, a @FDNY Battalion Chief, who died fulfilling his duty as a Firefighter at WTC Tower 2, 18 years ago.
Congratulations Kasie and Matt! https://twitter.com/kasie/status/1170003470830723073 …

I know pre-schools that require more tests for enrollment than our government requires to buy an AR-15. That is absurd. 

We must ban military-style assault weapons to stop mass killings.

.@HeidiHeitkamp is absolutely right. We have to make drastic reforms NOW to protect the pensions of millions of Americans. This is a crisis that will cripple our economy & middle class if we fail to act. https://www.cnbc.com/2019/09/03/heidi-heitkamp-protect-pensions-now-for-millions-of-americans.html …

There is no simple solution to the multiemployer #pensioncrisis. It’s going to require hard work, political courage, and bipartisan compromise, and America is running out of time. We need to get back to to civility in this country, and Republican's repeated pushing of inflammatory  rhetoric to divide and slander public servants who don't show blind obedience to President Trump is a continual corrosion of our democracy.

My cousin and close friend John, a FDNY Battalion Chief, was one of many who lost his life on 9/11 trying to save as many souls as possible at the Word Trade Center. 

To broadly accuse a political opponent of being sympathetic to such despicable actors is shameful and appalling.
I know firsthand how it feels to lose a loved one at the hands of terrorists.

RIP, my friend. 

Hector was a proud union leader. A shrewd political tactician. 

A person of his word at a time where that value has been diminished. And most importantly, a good and decent man. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/07/12/nyregion/hector-figueroa-union-leader-with-impact-dies-at-57.html?smid=nytcore-ios-share …

The Trump administration isn’t just failing to lead when it comes to the treatment of refugees - the president is failing a moral test. And as a country, we will be judged by our response to the suffering these humans are being forced to endure.

To walk into those facilities, only hours after finding out that CBP officials made sexist, racist, and sexually-charged comments about you, like Reps. @AOC, @RepEscobar, and others did, is incredibly brave.

As a father, as an American, as a person, I am heartbroken over the images & stories from the border. Proud that many of my former colleagues demanded to see the conditions firsthand & are forcing the inhumane treatment of refugees by the Trump admin into the public conscience.

Three years of @realDonaldTrump's   policies, and his daily disregard of democratic norms and decency, have already assured his place as one of the worst Presidents in American history. 

Tonight's impeachment leaves yet another permanent stain on his legacy.

After President Trump abused the power of his office for personal gain, and then tried to cover it up by obstructing Congress, the Democratic led House fulfilled their oath of office to uphold the Constitution and held him accountable via impeachment.
Today is a momentous day in our nation's history that reaffirms that no one, not even the President of the United States, is above the law.

We may all have different backgrounds, but we’re united by our shared dreams for this country. I believe in the best in America, its people, and its public servants.

My family is my everything. They taught me to pursue fairness and justice, to use my power – and my size, and my voice – for good. To give back. I hope I’ve done that. And I hope my colleagues will keep working together to do the same.

Some people have lost everything. Spare me the negativity and hate when we’re all pulling together to help rebuild.
